dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, you know, with the whole pandemic and everyone working from home, it really, uh, kinda changed how we think about work, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, you know, with the whole pandemic and everyone working from home, it really, uh, kinda changed how we think about work, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally, Host_A. And now that vaccinations are rolling out, like, people are really starting to look at combining that remote work with, you know, actual travel. Becoming a digital nomad, basically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally, Host A. And now that vaccinations are rolling out, like, people are really starting to look at combining that remote work with, you know, actual travel. Becoming a digital nomad, basically.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! And some countries are even, um, offering special visas to attract this new kind of tourism, which is pretty smart. But, like, how do you even *choose* where to go?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! And some countries are even, um, offering special visas to attract this new kind of tourism, which is pretty smart. But, like, how do you even choose where to go?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In response to the increased need to work from home many countries have introduced working holiday visas to encourage a new form of tourism to boost their badly affected coffers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? That's the big question. Luckily, a company called Circle Loop actually did the legwork. They looked at everything from internet speed and cost, to rental prices, and even, uh, remote job search availability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? That's the big question. Luckily, a company called Circle Loop actually did the legwork. They looked at everything from internet speed and cost, to rental prices, and even, uh, remote job search availability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With that in mind Circle Loop has done the legwork for you, taking in a range of factors from the price and speed of net connections to rental prices and remote job searches.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's comprehensive. So, what's the verdict? Who took the top spot in their Digital Nomad Index?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's comprehensive. So, what's the verdict? Who took the top spot in their Digital Nomad Index?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so this might surprise some people, but it's China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so this might surprise some people, but it's China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taking the top spot is Canada.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, apparently it scores super high. Fast internet, one of the top ten in the Global Happiness Index, and, like, a ton of remote job opportunities. Plus, it's considered really welcoming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, apparently it scores super high. Fast internet, one of the top ten in the Global Happiness Index, and, like, a ton of remote job opportunities. Plus, it's considered really welcoming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taking the top spot is Canada. Home to one of the largest tech hubs in the world it scores well across the board, from fast internet speeds to a top ten ranking on the Global Happiness Index and by far the most remote job search returns in the top ten. Coupled with its renown as one of the worlds friendliest and most welcoming countries...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that's genuinely interesting. And who's runner-up? I'm guessing another, um, unexpected one?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that's genuinely interesting. And who's runner-up? I'm guessing another, um, unexpected one?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Actually, it's the UK! Even with all the Brexit stuff, it's number two because of the sheer volume of remote jobs and, like, a high standard of living.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Actually, it's the U K! Even with all the Brexit stuff, it's number two because of the sheer volume of remote jobs and, like, a high standard of living.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Somewhat surprisingly considering the current turmoil of Brexit, the UK is the runner up thanks to the volume of remote jobs available coupled with a high standard of living.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The UK, huh? And then third?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The U K, huh? And then third?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Third place goes to Ukraine! Which, I'm pretty sure, isn't on most people's radar for digital nomadism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Third place goes to Ukraine! Which, I'm pretty sure, isn't on most people's radar for digital nomadism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Third place goes to Romania a country Id wager isnt on most peoples digital nomad radar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] No, not really! What makes Ukraine so good?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not really! What makes Ukraine so good?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's one of the fastest-growing tech markets in, um, Eastern Europe, and the living costs are incredibly low. Like, super-fast broadband for eighty bucks a month!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's one of the fastest-growing tech markets in, um, Eastern Europe, and the living costs are incredibly low. Like, super-fast broadband for eighty bucks a month!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But as one of the fastest growing information technology markets in Central and Eastern Europe, its a great marriage of opportunity and fantastically low living costs super fast fixed line broadband packages cost around $8 a month!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Eighty bucks! That's insane. So, it's not just the usual suspects then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eighty bucks! That's insane. So, it's not just the usual suspects then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not at all. The top ten actually has seven European countries, and then Japan is in there too, besides China. It's a real mix.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not at all. The top ten actually has seven European countries, and then Japan is in there too, besides China. It's a real mix.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Digital Nomad Index top ten features eight European countries. ...the only other non European country in the top ten is Australia in ninth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fascinating stuff. Definitely gives people some new ideas to, uh, consider for their next remote adventure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fascinating stuff. Definitely gives people some new ideas to, uh, consider for their next remote adventure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Time to pack those bags, I guess!
